Checks the compute_cpu_shares() function of util/cpu.py. It checks the equality of the result of a valid input.

Checks the compute_cpu_shares() function of util/cpu.py. It checks the equality of the result of a valid input.

Checks the compute_cpu_shares() function of util/cpu.py. It checks the equality of the result of a invalid input. It checks if the appropriate ValueError exception is raised.

file_test Module¶

Unittest Module for util/file.py.

class util.unittests.file_test.DefineTestFolder[source]¶

Defines within __init__ self.virtualfolder to become available within all methods of FileTestFileExist() Methods tested: testing file.py: –

class util.unittests.file_test.FileTestFileExist(methodName='runTest')[source]¶

Bases: unittest.case.TestCase

Contains methods for testing methods within file.py Methods checked: testing file.py: file_exists, is_file_exe, make_file_exe check_files_exist, check_files_executable

setUp()[source]¶

Creates a batch of files stored under fillist (filelist = namlist x extlist). Created files are stored under self.virtualfolder which is removed in tearDown()

tearDown()[source]¶

Deletes the batch of files stored created at setUp() and stored under self.virtualfolder

test01_file_exists()[source]¶

Checks if foo1.txt exists within self.virtualfolder folder

test02_file_exists()[source]¶

Checks if foo2.txt exists within the self.virtualfolder folder

test03_file_exists()[source]¶

Checks if foo3.txt exist within the self.virtualfolder.

test04_is_file_exe()[source]¶

Checks if foo1.txt within the self.virtualfolder is exe.

test05_is_file_exe()[source]¶

Checks if foo2.txt within the self.virtualfolder is exe.

test06_make_file_exe()[source]¶

Method that checks if foo2.sh file within the self.virtualfolder is exe.

test07_check_files_exist()[source]¶

Checks if files within tstlist are all existing with the self.virtualfolder

test08_check_files_executables()[source]¶

Modifies recursively self.virtualfolder so that all files become executables and tests if all files within the self.virtualfolder are executables

Unittest class that tests the different functionalities of the isalistofdictionaries() function in module util/html.py. The investigated cases are the following - Case that the input is a list of dictionaries - Case that the input is a list that its elements are not dictionaries - Case that the input is not a list at all

classmethod tearDownClass()[source]¶

test02_isalistofdictionaries()[source]¶

Checks the isalistofdictionaries() method of util/html.py. Checks the equality of the result of an input. - in this case is checked the result, when the provided input is a list that its elements are not dictionaries.

test03_isalistofdictionaries()[source]¶

Checks the isalistofdictionaries() method of util/html.py. Checks the equality of the result of an input. - in this case is checked the result, when the provided input is not a list at all.

netutil_test Module¶

Unittest Module for util/netutil.py.

class util.unittests.netutil_test.NetUtilTest(methodName='runTest')[source]¶

Bases: unittest.case.TestCase

Unitest class for testing methods within netutil.py Methods checked: testing file.py: ssh_connect_or_return, copy_to_target, make_remote_file_executable, ssh_run_command

setUp()[source]¶

Prepares the setup environment for testing methods ssh_connect_or_return, copy_to_target, make_remote_file_executable, ssh_run_command. The method assumes that a VM of certain ip, username, password is up. This method also creates a temporary file and a string with a location on the remote vm (need for the copy_to_target, make_remote_file_executable).

tearDown()[source]¶

Kills the environment prepared at method: setUp

test01_ssh_connect_or_return()[source]¶

Testing how ssh_connect_or_return when entering a ‘wrong’ remotemachineip

test02_ssh_connect_or_return()[source]¶

Testing how ssh_connect_or_return when entering a ‘wrong’ remotemachineusername

test03_ssh_copy_file_to_target()[source]¶

Testing how ssh_copy_file_to_target

process_test Module¶

Unittest Module for util/process.py.

class util.unittests.process_test.ProcessTestAllFunctions(methodName='runTest')[source]¶

Bases: unittest.case.TestCase

This Unittest class tests the different functionalities of the module util/process.py.

classmethod setUpClass()[source]¶

Initializes the testing environment parameters. Starts the server process

classmethod tearDownClass()[source]¶

Cleans the testing environment parameters. Stops the server process we started

test01_getpid_listeningonport()[source]¶

Checks the getpid_listeningonport() function of util/process.py module. Checks the equality between the known process id of the initializes server, with the one returned from the function.

test01_is_process_running()[source]¶

Checks the is_process_running() function of util/process.py module. In this scenario we check the result in case we give as input to the function a valid process id.

test02_getpid_listeningonport()[source]¶

Checks the getpid_listeningonport() function of util/process.py module. In this scenario we check the result in case we give as input to the function, a port number on which a process that the user not owns is listening.

test02_is_process_running()[source]¶

Checks the is_process_running() function of util/process.py module. In this scenario we check the result in case we give as input to the function a invalid process id.

test03_getpid_listeningonport()[source]¶

Checks the getpid_listeningonport() function of util/process.py module. In this scenario we check the result in case we give as input to the function something that is not a port number.

test03_is_process_running()[source]¶

Checks the is_process_running() function of util/process.py module. In this scenario we check the result in case we give as input to the function a invalid process id.

util.unittests.process_test.server_init(listen_port)[source]¶

The helper method start a server process that listens to a predefined port

Parameters:listen_port – The port number where the server process is listening

:returns A socket object that will be passed inside the server process (see function server_thread()). :rtype: socket.socket()

util.unittests.process_test.server_thread(socket_obj)[source]¶

Runs as a separate child process. It takes as argument a socket object.
